Add globalVariables() and use it in check and in reference classes.  From 59232

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r59232 | jmc | 2012-04-27 12:19:52 -0400 (Fri, 27 Apr 2012) | 4 lines
Changed paths:
   M /trunk/src/library/methods/R/refClass.R
   M /trunk/src/library/tools/R/QC.R
   M /trunk/src/library/utils/NAMESPACE
   M /trunk/src/library/utils/R/packages2.R
   A /trunk/src/library/utils/man/globalVariables.Rd

1. add the function globalVariables() to utils, to record declarations of global variables
2. the check tool queries globalVariables() and passes anything found on to codetools
3. the reference class code in methods uses globalVarialbes() to avoid spurious complaints about fields and methods in method definitions.

Missing default in backsolve generic (bug report 14883)

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r59150 | jmc | 2012-04-23 18:03:36 -0400 (Mon, 23 Apr 2012) | 7 lines
Changed paths:
   M /trunk/src/library/base/R/namespace.R

Two fixes related to load actions.

1.  These may (often will) add new objects to the namespace, so the export patterns if any need to be applied after cacheMetaData()

2.  with or without patterns, the load actions should not be able to export objects that "should never be exported".  So the check for these
   needs to be moved to follow any load actions.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r59149 | jmc | 2012-04-23 17:59:59 -0400 (Mon, 23 Apr 2012) | 8 lines
Changed paths:
   M /trunk/src/library/methods/R/RMethodUtils.R

Two fixes to .doLoadActions:

1 - From some hard-to-pin down examples, load actions don't work without the methods package (and there is no sensible reason to try
   other than the test in check, for what that is worth.)

2- Incorrect error message call when a load action throws an error.
